where_to_read: Hi ho, hi ho, its off to work we go

reviews.review_text: Doyle seems to be writing movie scripts which he's passing off as novels. All dialogue but it needs something more to flesh out the characters, like thoughts, feelings (or actors).
my wife started to read it but gave up.

The copy I purchased has the WORST font ever!  The print is thick and messy.  Like the ink is globbed on.  I'd return this book but it's too late.  That teaches me to not open a book immediately when it's delivered.
One you can miss along with all his writings

Well, Jimmy, tell us about the books. They're grand, absolutely grand.A fan of the movie version of The Commitments, I was drawn to The Guts and fell in love again with the whole cast of characters.All three novels in the trilogy have something unique to offer. With The Guts, the four books represent a lasting accomplishment.

Heart-warming and delightful. This is my second read of this trilogy which focusses on the different members of the Rabbite Family ... The colours are vibrant and true to life, awkward in their truth ... you cannot help but love them and want to know what happens next.  Definitely a 5 star read - definitely helpful to understand some Irish slang as a lot of the gems of the story are intricately wrapped in the lingo =)
He's a great author. I love all these books.
I wish I loved this trilogy, but it got old about halfway through. I lost interest.

Really enjoyed this trilogy featuring the Rabbitte family from a town outside of Dublin. It was the second and third book in the trilogy which really captured my attention.All of the books are written with humor but important themes such as family ties, self respect and friendship are well expressed.I initially had some difficulty with some of the wording but as I read on it was easy to get the gist of what the author was saying. I laughed out loud in places and even though the trilogy was extremely funny there were pertinent themes addressed.Really enjoyed the trilogy overall.

I love this trilogy. I have read it many times and it always makes me laugh out loud. The stories are touching in an everyday human foible sort of way, but they are told with humor. I would recommend Roddy Doyle to anyone.

title: The Barrytown Trilogy

summary:
This volume brings together under one cover Roddy Doyle's three acclaimed novels about the Rabbite family from Dublin. 

The Commitments traces the rapid rise and even more rapid fall of Jimmy Rabbite Jr's unusual soul band. 

In The Snapper, Sharon Rabbite's pregnancy sparks off intense speculation among her friends and family, but she is determined to reveal the identity of the father in her own time. 

The Van, set during Ireland's 1990 World Cup attempt, follows the fortunes of Jimmy Sr and his friend Bimbo as they launch their travelling fish'n'chip shop on an unsuspecting Barrytown, learning much about themselves in the process.

"Mr. Doyle has made his own the gritty world of modern Dublin." New York Times
story_arc:
Bad luck, followed by promise, ending in a
                    final fall
